intro: Diosma lanceolata, commonly known as the narrowleaf diosma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Diosma lanceolata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in native plant gardens.
